Name: dong chong xia cao
冬蟲夏草
Biological: Cordyceps sinensis (Berk.) Sacc. and usually the larvae are the remains of Hepialus varians
Other: yarsa gumba (Nepalese name of Tibetan origin)
yartsa gunbu (dbyar rtswa dgun 'bu, Tibetan name)

Geography: regions above 3,000 meters elevation with cold climate
Maladies Treated: impotence due to kidney yang deficiency (shenyangxu)
chronic lower back pain due to kidney yang deficiency
afraid of cold due to kidney yang deficiency
over abundance of mucus and tears due to lung and kidney deficiency
chronic cough and wheezing from deficiency due to lung yin and kidney yang deficiency
blood in phlegm from consumption due to kidney yang deficiency
weakness and coughing blood
erectile dysfunction and spermatorrhea
chronic bronchial inflammation in weak elderly individuals
Medical Function: tonifies lung yin and kidney yang, balancing yin and yang
effective adjuvant therapy in hematopoietic dysfunction and cancer
cordyceps polysaccharide has bidirectional immuno-modulatory effects on peripheral blood lymphocytes
significantly improves deformability of erythrocytes after strenuous exercise; effect increases with concentration
significantly inhibits lipid peroxidation of membrane after exercise, has strong scavenging effect

protects kidneys from toxins and exhaustion; antagonizes aminoglycoside-induced reduction in renal oxygen consumption; increases renal tubular Na+-K+-ATPase activity and reduces aminoglycoside lysosomal lipid peroxidation damage; reduces calcium content in tissues; protects renal tubular cells by induction of c-myc gene expression and modulation of epidermal growth factor; promotes renal repair and regeneration after injury

In a cyclosporin A-induced acute nephrotoxicity rat model, Cordyceps exhibited renal protective effects. The rise in serum creatinine and blood urea nitrogen (BUN) was significantly slower in the Cordyceps group compared to the control (P < 0.01). Cordyceps may help correct cyclosporin-induced abnormalities in renal hemodynamics. Additionally, the reduction in urinary sodium and potassium excretion was less pronounced in the Cordyceps group, whereas the control group showed a marked decline over time (P < 0.01). The activities of mitochondrial Na⁺-K⁺-ATPase and Ca²⁺-ATPase in renal tissues were significantly higher in the Cordyceps group than in controls (P < 0.05). Cordyceps also enhanced intracellular mitochondrial respiratory function, thereby increasing energy production to maintain normal ion gradients across the cell membrane and promoting the repair of damaged cells, which may be one of its key mechanisms of action.

Using a 5/6 nephrectomy model to study chronic renal failure (CRF), Cordyceps demonstrated significant preventive and therapeutic effects. After 90 days of treatment, rats in the Cordyceps group showed significantly lower levels of serum creatinine, blood urea nitrogen (BUN), triglycerides, cholesterol, and 24-hour urine protein compared to the control group (P < 0.05). The urinary excretion rate of 3-methylhistidine was also significantly reduced (P < 0.05), while protein synthesis rates in liver and muscle tissues were notably higher. Histological analysis revealed markedly less glomerulosclerosis, tubular atrophy, and interstitial fibrosis in the Cordyceps group (P < 0.05). At 120 days, mortality was 33.33% in the Cordyceps group versus 42.22% in controls. By 180 days, the levels of valine, leucine, isoleucine, lysine, tyrosine, and the combined intracellular and extracellular concentrations of branched-chain amino acids were all significantly higher in the Cordyceps group (P < 0.05). These findings suggest that Cordyceps can delay renal function decline in CRF, reduce proteinuria, correct disturbances in amino acid, protein, and lipid metabolism, and inhibit the progression of glomerulosclerosis and tubulointerstitial injury.

Using two pathological models of liver injury—carbon tetrachloride (CCl₄) and thioacetamide (TAA)—Cordyceps liposomes demonstrated a protective effect, significantly reducing serum ALT levels in a dose-dependent manner. Histopathological analysis revealed that Cordyceps liposomes offered notable protection against CCl₄-induced liver damage, with liver tissue structures appearing close to normal. However, no significant improvement was observed in the TAA-induced model, likely due to the irreversible nature of the injury caused by TAA.

In a study on the prevention and treatment of liver fibrosis, rats were administered Cordyceps water extract via gavage, resulting in significantly lower serum procollagen III (PCIII) levels compared to controls. Histological examination showed clear reductions in hepatocyte degeneration, necrosis, and fibrous tissue proliferation. Collagen deposition of types I, III, and IV in liver tissue was also lighter, with suppressed synthesis of type IV collagen. Electron microscopy revealed that Cordyceps inhibited the proliferation of fibroblast-like cells in liver sinusoids (FSC) and their transformation into myofibroblasts. These findings suggest that the anti-fibrotic mechanism of Cordyceps may involve suppression of FSC proliferation and transformation, thereby reducing the liver’s capacity to synthesize collagen.

protects heart from ouabain-induced toxicity in guinea pigs; Intraperitoneal administration of Cordyceps mycelial ethanol extract (Cordyceps B) significantly increased the LD₁₀₀ and delayed the onset of ouabain-induced cardiac toxicity in guinea pigs, while also enhancing superoxide dismutase (SOD) activity and reducing oxidative metabolites in a dose-dependent manner.

anti-arrhythmic effect in animal models (rats, mice, guinea pigs, rabbits) against arrhythmia induced by aconitine, barium chloride, adrenaline. Cordyceps demonstrated clear inhibitory effects on arrhythmias induced by aconitine, barium chloride, and adrenaline in rats, mice, guinea pigs, and rabbits, while it worsened arrhythmias caused by isoproterenol and showed no effect on those induced by ouabain, suggesting that its anti-arrhythmic action likely involves a direct effect on the heart.

improves cardiac function: Cordyceps B affected cardiac function in several ways: intravenous injection of 1.5 g/kg in anesthetized rats slowed heart rate, which returned to normal within approximately 5 minutes; subcutaneous injection of 5 g/kg significantly increased hypoxia tolerance in mice and enhanced myocardial uptake of rubidium, indicating improved perfusion; and intraperitoneal injection of 2.5 g/kg markedly reduced myocardial oxygen consumption.
anti-rejection effect in cornea transplant, enhancing immunosuppressive effects and steroid effectiveness.
Samples of Formulae: For weak elderly persons with chronic bronchia inflammation: dong chong xia cao (cordyceps) 10 g, kuan dong hua 6 g, sang bai pi 8 g, gan cao 3 g, xiao hui xiang 2 g, boiled in 600 cc of water down to 200 cc; to be taken in 3 servings per day. For weakness and coughing blood: dong chong xia cao (cordyceps), sha shen, mai dong, sheng di huang; boiled in water and taken in 3 servings daily. Erectile dysfunction and spermatorrhea: dong chong xia cao (cordyceps), gou qi zi, shan zhu yu, huai shan yao, boiled in water and divided into 3 servings per day.
Contraindications: Large dosages and/or long-term usage can be toxic to kidneys. Strict rules apply in Taiwan regarding selling cordycep mycelium.
Research: See detailed descriptions of medical functions above; multiple studies conducted on animals (rats, mice, guinea pigs, rabbits) demonstrate protective effects on immunity, kidneys, liver, heart, and anti-bacterial functions.
Notes:
According to the traditional Chinese medicine text Ben Cao Bei Yao (Essentials of Materia Medica), Cordyceps produced in Jiading Prefecture of Sichuan was considered the highest in quality. Today, most of the Cordyceps sold on the market comes from Tibet and Qinghai, where the insect bodies tend to be larger, making them more expensive. These are typically sold individually and referred to as “scattered Cordyceps” (san chong). 
 When about eight pieces of Cordyceps are bundled together with a red string into a small bunch, and then several small bunches are tied together into a larger bundle weighing about four liang (roughly 150g), it is called “bundled Cordyceps” (ba chong). However, many dishonest sellers mix in sand, stones, or plant materials that resemble Cordyceps to artificially increase the weight, so buyers must be very cautious when purchasing. 
 Lin Yi-Hsin, the chairperson of the Traditional Chinese Medicine Committee under Taiwan’s Department of Health, stated that the Cordyceps mycelium popular in the health supplement industry today does not involve insects. Instead, specific Cordyceps strains are selected and cultivated using soybeans, grains, amino acids, and other nutrients, which are fermented in controlled environments for temperature and humidity. After fermentation, the Cordyceps mycelium is harvested and its active components extracted and dried into powder. Because these mycelium-based products are not derived from whole Cordyceps, food manufacturers are not allowed to claim any therapeutic effects. Furthermore, Cordyceps mycelium capsules are not classified as health foods. If companies mislead consumers by making medical claims, they will be penalized by the Department of Health under the Pharmaceutical Affairs Act for selling counterfeit or adulterated drugs. 
 According to manufacturers, the active components of Cordyceps mycelium—such as amino acids, polysaccharides, adenosine, nucleosides, fatty acids, mannitol, and trace elements—are largely similar to those found in natural Cordyceps. Pharmacological analysis also suggests similar effects. However, natural Cordyceps is easier to visually inspect for authenticity, while Cordyceps mycelium is harder for the average consumer to evaluate, making it more difficult to detect counterfeits. Therefore, consumers must be extremely careful when purchasing to avoid buying fake products that may be harmful to health.
Chemical Ingredients: Amino acids including lysine, aspartic acid, threonine, taurine

bacteriaThe following to be translated in detail:1　對免疫及血液系統的作用 提高機體免疫功能。蟲草對免疫或造血功能障礙低下﹐癌症等是有效的輔助治療。  虫草多糖對外周血淋巴細胞具有雙向免疫調節作用。 對巨噬細胞免疫活性的增強作用。 劇烈運動後紅細胞變形能力下降有明顯改善作用，並有濃度依賴關系。隨著濃度增加，其改善作用增強。 能顯著抑制脂質過氧化，對運動後膜脂質過氧化物有較強的清除作用。 2　對腎臟的作用 　對腎毒性損傷的防治作用作用﹔機制可能包括：(1)拮抗氨基糖苷所致腎臟氧耗下降，提高腎小管Na＋-K＋-ATP酶活力；(2)減輕 氨基糖 苷溶酶 體損傷的脂質過氧化損傷；(3)降低組織鈣含量；(4)通過誘導腎小管細胞c-myc基因表達以及對損傷狀態下腎組織表皮生 長因子調節的 保護，促進腎 小管的再生修復。 2.2　對急性腎毒性的保護作用〔6〕：利用環孢A致急性腎毒性動物模型，觀察冬蟲夏草對大鼠腎功能的保護作用。實驗發現：冬蟲夏草組血清肌酐﹐ 尿素氮 上升較 為遲緩，與對照組比較P＜0.01。這種改變可能與冬蟲夏草改善環孢A所致的腎血流量動力學異常有關；冬蟲夏草組尿鈉﹐鉀排出量較實 驗前下降幅 度 較小，而對照 組隨實驗時間的延長有明顯下降(P＜0.01)；冬蟲夏草組腎組織線粒體Na＋-K＋-ATP及Ca2＋-ATP酶 活性明顯高於對照 組(P＜0.05)。 改善細胞內線粒體呼吸功能，使其增加能量以維持細胞內外正常的離子梯度，加速病損細胞的修復，這可 能是冬蟲夏草的作用機制之一。 2.3　對慢性腎功能衰竭的防治作用〔7〕：利用腎大部分切除術建立慢性腎功能衰竭(CRF)模型，觀察冬蟲夏草對殘余腎組織和腎功能的影響 。結果 ：(1)冬 蟲夏草組 治90 d時，大鼠的血清肌酐﹐尿素氮﹐甘油三酯﹐膽固醇和24 h尿蛋白均明顯低於對照組(P＜0.05)；(2)冬蟲夏草組 尿3-甲 基 組氨酸排泄率明 顯低於對照組(P＜0.05)；冬蟲夏草組的肝臟和肌肉組織蛋白合成速率亦顯著高於對照組；(3)冬蟲夏草組的腎小球硬 化﹐腎小管萎縮 和間質纖維化程度均明顯 低於對照組(P＜0.05)；(4)治療120 d時，冬蟲夏草組死亡率為33.33%，對照組為42.22%；(5)治 療180 d時，冬蟲夏草組的頡﹐亮﹐ 異亮﹐賴酪氨酸水平以及細胞內外的支鏈氨基酸之和均明顯高於對照組(P＜0.05)。提示：冬蟲夏草能延緩CRF大 鼠的腎 功 能減退，減輕蛋白尿，糾正氨基 酸﹐蛋白質和脂質代謝紊亂，抑制殘余腎組織的腎小球硬化和腎小管-間質損傷的發展。 3　對肝臟的作用 3.1　對肝損傷的保護作用〔8〕：用四氯化碳 (CCl4)及硫代乙酰胺(TAA)致小鼠肝損傷的兩種病理模型觀察冬蟲夏草對其預防及治療作用。實驗結 果 ：CCl4或TAA致 肝損傷的小鼠口服冬蟲夏草脂質體後，均可使肝損傷的ALT有不同程度下降，且下降幅度與劑量有關。小鼠肝組織病理切片顯 示， 冬蟲夏草脂質體對CCl4損 傷的肝 組織有一定的保護作用，肝組織結構顯示接近正常組織，但對TAA損傷的肝組織未見有明顯改善，可能由於TAA致 小 鼠肝損傷的不可逆性。 3.2　對肝纖維化的防治作用〔9〕：以冬蟲夏草水溶液大鼠灌胃的方式，觀察其對CCl4誘發的肝纖維化的療效。結果：冬蟲夏草組血清PCⅢ明顯 低於對 照組； 肝細胞變性﹐壞死﹐纖維組織增生亦明顯輕於對照組；冬蟲夏草組Ⅰ﹐Ⅲ﹐Ⅳ型膠原在肝組織中的沉積亦輕於對照組，並能抑制肝細胞合 成Ⅳ型膠原。 超微結構研究 發現，冬蟲夏草不僅抑制FSC(位於肝竇狹氏間隙的成纖維細胞系細胞)增殖，還能抑制FSC向肌成纖維細胞及成纖維 細胞轉化。因此推測冬 蟲夏草抗 肝纖維化的機 制可能是通過抑制FSC增殖和向肌成纖維細胞及成纖維細胞轉化，從而減弱FSC合成膠原的能力。 4　對心臟的作用 So be very careful when buying to avoid buying fake merchandise and affect your health根據中醫古籍「本草備要」 記載， 產自四 川嘉定府的冬蟲夏草其品質最佳。目前市面上所賣的，多半是產自西藏﹐青海一帶 ，因其蟲體較大，價錢較為貴。一般作一 尾一尾 分開來賣。稱 為「散蟲」。把冬蟲草八尾左右用紅繩捆成一小把 ，又 縛成一大把約 四兩重。稱 為「 把蟲」。有很多奸商把沙石與類似蟲類的植物混在其中以加 重其重 量。購買時把須小心。台灣衛生署中醫 藥委員 會主委林宜信說，現在保健食品界風行的冬蟲夏草菌絲體並未使用到昆蟲，而是篩選 特定的 蟲草菌株，用大豆﹐穀物﹐氨基酸等營養劑，注入發酵槽中控制溫濕度，發酵 培養出冬蟲夏草菌絲體後，從中提取有效物質製成乾粉。所以製造冬蟲夏草菌絲體的食品﹐食品業者不能宣稱療效，而冬蟲夏草菌絲體膠囊也不是健康食品，業者若誤導視 聽，衛生署將依藥事法，以賣偽藥﹐混用藥等相關法律處罰。據業者說冬蟲夏草菌 絲 有效成分，如氨基酸類，多糖類 ， 腺苷，核苷，脂肪酸，甘露醇 和微量元素等大多與天然蟲草相近。其藥理分析也與天然 冬蟲夏草有相似之處云 。天然的冬蟲夏草容易看得清楚也會有偽冒的假貨。一般消費 者更加不能分辨冬蟲 夏草菌絲的真偽。所以購買時須十分小心以免買到對健康不良的假貨。 Search this siteProblems with website? Name: yang gan ju
Other: German gan ju 德國甘菊

Geography: Northern and western parts of Xinjiang, Taiwan, Beijing
Maladies Treated: irritable bowel syndrome
stomach pain
Medical Function: antibiotic: the essential oil, in vitro, shows inhibitory effect on Staphylococcus aureus, Mycobacterium B6, Michigan, Corynebacterium, Candida albicans
inhibits morphine dependence in rats and reduces symptoms of withdrawal syndrome
Contraindications: Use this herb with care if you are allergic to plants in the Asteraceae (Compositae) family like aster, chrysanthemum, mugwort, ragweed, and ragwort, or if using blood thinner like warfarin.
Research: The essential oil, in vitro experiments, shows inhibitory effects on Staphylococcus aureus, Mycobacterium B6, Michigan, Corynebacterium, Candida albicans. An in vitro study indicates chamomile has inhibitory effects on human main drug metabolic enzymes. Research in rats demonstrates chamomile's inhibitory effect on morphine dependence and reducing withdrawal syndrome symptoms.

Flavonoids: apigenin, quercetin, luteolin, quercetagetin, rutin, hyperoside, apigenin-7-O-glycoside, cosmosiin, jaceidin, chrysosplenol D, eupatolitin, spinacetin, axillarin, eupalitin, patulitrin, quercimeritrin
Coumarins: umbelliferone, methylumbelliferin, herniarin, esculetin, scopoletin, isoscopoletin
Others: xylose, arabinose, galactose, glucose, rhamnose

Name: pu gong ying
Other: huang hua di ding 黃花地丁

Geography: Especially Shanxi, Hebei, Shandong, and northeast provinces
Maladies Treated: swelling and pain in breast cancer due to heat toxin
boils due to heat toxin
lung cancer with coughing blood and pus
Medical Function: diuretic effect (contain large amount of potassium)

inhibits Staphylococcus aureus, Streptococcus pneumoniae, Pseudomonas aeruginosa, Shigella spp., Neisseria meningitidis, Corynebacterium diphtheriae, Mycobacterium tuberculosis, ECHO virus, Leptospira
Research: The decoction of pu gong ying can enhance the effect of trimethoprimum (TMP). The ideal combination is pu gong ying 2.5 g (raw herb): TMP 10 mg. Taraxacum formosanum shows that it can help prevent osteoporosis especially for menopausal women.[1]
